page.title: 20900 Years On
page.content: The only entry in the original Domesday Book which concerns a part of our area is as follows: "Land of Robert of Stafford..In Cauldon 1 virgate of land. Land for 1 plough. Waste. Godiva held it before 1066." As you will have seen, things have changed beyond recognition and during the next 900 years the information we have compiled will seem just as strange to the readers of the future. However, we have tried our best and hope that the time and effort of the following will be of use in appreciating life in our area in 1985: Waterhouses First and Middle School pupils, in particular J. Goldstraw, R.Brooks, M.Flint, D.Hall, L.Burndred, M.Phillips, A.Bradshaw, M. Thacker, J.Wint, L.Finnikin, A.Poole, D.Ratcliffe, T.Wardle, A.Richardson and S.Allen. Teachers: M.Smith, D.Walters and J.Crawford. Typed by Mrs.M.Birch.
